intro: Actinocephalus deflexus, commonly known as the twisted actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
